prereq.li: User should Select "Create Test Campaign" option from Quick Links

info.p: Test Campaign Parameters that should be specified include:

sl.sli: Description of test campaign: the purpose and scope of test campaign
Feature: (Optional) the features that all test cases in campaign should fall under. Can be left blank if unsure and it wont limit what test cases can be added
Component: (Optional) the components that all test cases in campaign should fall under. Can be left blank if unsure and it wont limit what test cases can be added
Drop: the test campaign is applicable for. This field is automatically populated from information in jira.
Environment: the specific environment the tests are planned for
Start and End dates: for tracking purposes
PS-From and PS-To: (Optional) Depending upon the drop which is selected,required ISO's should be given here.
Guide Revision: (Optional) Required Guide Revision should be given here
SED Revision: (Optional) Required SED Revision should be given here
Other Dependent SW: (Optional) Required Other Dependent SW should be given here
Node Type and Version: (Optional) Required Node Type and Version should be given here
SoV Status: (Optional) Required Sov status should be given here. (Recommended values are Compliant, Non Compliant, Partially Compliant)
Comment: (Optional) Comment should be given here

step.cmd: Assign test cases to test campaign

info.p: Test cases need to be assigned to the given test campaign. Use the “Add Multiple” option to find the test cases and add them to the campaign.

step.cmd: Find & Select test cases to add to test campaign

info.p: This provides the user with the search criteria to find your test cases. Multiple search criteria can be applied here to find your test cases.
In this example a search finds all test cases where the Component field contains the word "Deployment".

ol.li: Select the Test Cases you want to Add
Click "Add Selected" to add them to your test plan
Click the Highlighted arrow to return to Test Plan Create Page

step.cmd: Assign Test Cases to a User

info.p: This can be done using the “Assign to User Option”. Select the test cases in the test campaign create/edit page and assign them to users. Corporate user id’s can be used and they will be matched against the corporate ldap server. The users will receive an e-mail with a link to the test campaign. NB. When assigning test cases via Edit Test Campaign, always ensure to save the test campaign, otherwise the emails will not be sent.

step.info: When you are happy with the content of your test campaign use the "Create" button to complete the creation of the test campaign.

result.p: When the Test Campaign has been created, test cases assigned to users are visible in their Inbox.
